title: Josh Quaas' Sports Data Site
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors



srs <- read_csv("PowerfiveSRS - Sheet1.csv")

Rows: 25 Columns: 3
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Conf
dbl (2): Year, SRS

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



ggplot() + geom_step(data=srs, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf, color=Conf)) 









SEC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "SEC")


BIG <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Big Ten")


Bigtwelve <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Big 12")


PAC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Pac-12")


ACC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "ACC")


 ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=SEC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="gold") + geom_line(data=BIG, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="skyblue") + geom_line(data=Bigtwelve, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="red") + geom_line(data=PAC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="darkblue") + geom_line(data=ACC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="darkgrey")+ 
  labs(
    x="Season", 
    y="Simple Rating System", 
    title="The Big Ten Has Only Been On Top Once", 
    subtitle="The SEC has controlled the top spot for most of the last five years. The Big Ten\nhas struggled to be the top Conference.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Josh Quaas"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )

title: Which Power Five Conference Has Peformed The Best Over The Last Five Full Seasons
text:
Write stuff


Code
library(tidyverse)

srs <- read_csv("PowerfiveSRS - Sheet1.csv")

SEC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "SEC")

BIG <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Big Ten")

Bigtwelve <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Big 12")

PAC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "Pac-12")

ACC <- srs |> 
  filter(Conf == "ACC")

 ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=SEC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="gold") + geom_line(data=BIG, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="skyblue") + geom_line(data=Bigtwelve, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="red") + geom_line(data=PAC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="darkblue") + geom_line(data=ACC, aes(x=Year, y=SRS, group=Conf), color="darkgrey")+ 
  labs(
    x="Season", 
    y="Simple Rating System", 
    title="The Big Ten Has Only Been On Top Once", 
    subtitle="The SEC has controlled the top spot for most of the last five years. The Big Ten\nhas struggled to be the top Conference.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Josh Quaas"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 









more typing


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)

bowls <- read_csv("CFBPostseason - Sheet1.csv")

Conferences <- c("Big Ten", "SEC", "Pac-12", "Big 12", "ACC")

bowls |> 
  arrange(desc(Wins)) |> 
  gt() |> 
  cols_label(
    TotalGames = "Total Games",
    WinPercentage = "Win %",
    CFBPlayoffAppearences = "CFB Playoff Appearences",
    Wins = "W",
    Losses = "L"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "The Power Five's Postseason Statistics",
    subtitle = "The SEC once again is on top, including three championships. The SEC and Big Ten are the only two conferences with over .500 winning percentages in bowl games the past five full seasons."
  ) |> 
   tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Josh Quaas  |  **Source:** (https://www.sportsreference.com")
  ) |> 
   tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> 
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |> 
   tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=14)
     )
   ) |> 
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |> 
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "darkblue"),
      cell_text(color = "gold")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Conference == "SEC")
  ) |> 
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "black"),
      cell_text(color = "cyan")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Conference == "Big Ten")
  )









The Power Five's Postseason Statistics


The SEC once again is on top, including three championships. The SEC and Big Ten are the only two conferences with over .500 winning percentages in bowl games the past five full seasons.

more typing here as well


Code
library(tidyverse)

wl <- read_csv("Conftotalwinpercentage - Sheet1.csv")
BIG <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "Big Ten"
  )  
  SEC <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "SEC"
  )  
  ACC <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "ACC"
  )  
  PAC <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "Pac-12"
  ) 
  BTwelve <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "Big 12"
  ) 
wl |> 
  ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=wl, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage)) +
  geom_bar(data=BIG, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="black") +
   geom_bar(data=SEC, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="darkblue") +
   geom_bar(data=ACC, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="black") +
   geom_bar(data=PAC, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="black") +
   geom_bar(data=BTwelve, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="black") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    x="Conference", 
    y="Win Percentage", 
    title="All CFB Conferences Win Percentage", 
    subtitle="The SEC by these statistics have won the best percentage of their games over the\nlast five full seasons. All Power Five Conferences are in the top five.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Josh Quaas"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) 









an ending here to type at

title: Josh Quaas' Sports Data Site
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

wl <- read_csv("Conftotalwinpercentage - Sheet1.csv")

Rows: 11 Columns: 5
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (2): Conference, Seasons
dbl (3): Wins, Losses, WinPercentage

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

BIG <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "Big Ten"
  )  
  SEC <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "SEC"
  )  
  ACC <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "ACC"
  )  
  PAC <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "Pac-12"
  ) 
  BTwelve <- wl |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "Big 12"
  ) 
wl |> 
  ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=wl, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage)) +
  geom_bar(data=BIG, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="black") +
   geom_bar(data=SEC, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="darkblue") +
   geom_bar(data=ACC, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="black") +
   geom_bar(data=PAC, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="black") +
   geom_bar(data=BTwelve, aes(x=reorder(Conference, WinPercentage), weight=WinPercentage), fill="black") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    x="Conference", 
    y="Win Percentage", 
    title="Conference Win Percentage", 
    subtitle="The SEC by these statistics have won the best percentage of their games over the\nlast five full seasons. All Power Five Conferences are in the top five.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Josh Quaas"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    )

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(gt)

Warning: package 'gt' was built under R version 4.3.3

bowls <- read_csv("CFBPostseason - Sheet1.csv")

Rows: 5 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Conference
dbl (6): Wins, Losses, TotalGames, WinPercentage, Championships, CFBPlayoffA...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

Conferences <- c("Big Ten", "SEC", "Pac-12", "Big 12", "ACC")

bowls |> 
  arrange(desc(Wins)) |> 
  gt() |> 
  cols_label(
    TotalGames = "Total Games",
    WinPercentage = "Win %",
    CFBPlayoffAppearences = "CFB Playoff Appearences",
    Wins = "W",
    Losses = "L"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "The Power Five's Postseason Statistics",
    subtitle = "The SEC once again is on top, including three championships. The SEC and Big Ten are the only two conferences with over .500 winning percentages in bowl games the past five full seasons."
  ) |> 
   tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Josh Quaas  |  **Source:** (https://www.sportsreference.com")
  ) |> 
   tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> 
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |> 
   tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=14)
     )
   ) |> 
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |> 
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "darkblue"),
      cell_text(color = "gold")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Conference == "SEC")
  ) |>

    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "black"),
      cell_text(color = "cyan")
      ),

      rows = Conference == "Big Ten")
